AI Description: Canu is a software tool that is used for assembling genomes using nanopore sequencing data. It is designed to be efficient and scalable, making it suitable for large and complex genomes.
Core Features: Some of the key features of Canu include error correction, trimming, assembling, and visualization of long-read sequencing data. It also includes support for multi-genome assembly and variant calling.
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Nanopore Sequencing, Long-Read Sequencing, Bioinformatics
